title: Authors and Citation
text: Lang M, Schratz P, Sonabend R, Becker M, Richter J, Zobolas J (2024). mlr3viz: Visualizations 'mlr3'. R package version 0.10.0.9000, https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr3viz, https://mlr3viz.mlr-org.com.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mlr3viz: Visualizations for 'mlr3'},   author = {Michel Lang and Patrick Schratz and Raphael Sonabend and Marc Becker and Jakob Richter and John Zobolas},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.10.0.9000, https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr3viz},   url = {https://mlr3viz.mlr-org.com}, }

title: Visualizations for mlr3
text: Package website: release | dev mlr3viz visualization package mlr3 ecosystem. features plots mlr3 objects tasks, learners, predictions, benchmark results, tuning instances filters via autoplot() generic ggplot2. package draws plots viridis color palette applies minimal theme. Visualizations include barplots, boxplots, histograms, ROC curves, Precision-Recall curves. gallery features showcase post plots mlr3viz.

title: Visualizations for mlr3
text: Install last release CRAN: Install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("mlr3") remotes::install_github("mlr-org/mlr3viz")

title: Visualizations for mlr3
text: gallery features showcase post visualization functions mlr3viz.

title: Visualizations for mlr3
text: example plots can look pkgdown references respective functions.
code: library(mlr3) library(mlr3viz)  task = tsk("pima") learner = lrn("classif.rpart", predict_type = "prob") rr = resample(task, learner, rsmp("cv", folds = 3), store_models = TRUE)  # Default plot for task autoplot(task, type = "target") # ROC curve for resample result autoplot(rr, type = "roc")

title: Convert to 'precrec' Format — as_precrec
text: Converts format understood precrec::evalmod() package precrec.

title: Convert to 'precrec' Format — as_precrec
code: as_precrec(object)  # S3 method for class 'PredictionClassif' as_precrec(object)  # S3 method for class 'ResampleResult' as_precrec(object)  # S3 method for class 'BenchmarkResult' as_precrec(object)

title: Convert to 'precrec' Format — as_precrec
text: object () Object convert.

title: Convert to 'precrec' Format — as_precrec
text: Object created precrec::mmdata().

title: Convert to 'precrec' Format — as_precrec
text: Saito T, Rehmsmeier M (2017). “Precrec: fast accurate precision-recall ROC curve calculations R.” Bioinformatics, 33(1), 145-147. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btw570 .

title: Plots for Benchmark Results — autoplot.BenchmarkResult
text: Visualizations mlr3::BenchmarkResult. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "boxplot" (default): Boxplots performance measures, one box per mlr3::Learner one facet per mlr3::Task. "roc": ROC curve (1 - specificity x, sensitivity y). mlr3::BenchmarkResult may single mlr3::Task single mlr3::Resampling. Note can subset mlr3::BenchmarkResult $filter()  method (see examples). Requires package precrec. "prc": Precision recall curve. See "roc".

title: Plots for Benchmark Results — autoplot.BenchmarkResult
code: # S3 method for class 'BenchmarkResult' autoplot(   object,   type = "boxplot",   measure = NULL,   theme = theme_minimal(),   ... )

title: Plots for Benchmark Results — autoplot.BenchmarkResult
text: object (mlr3::BenchmarkResult). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. measure (mlr3::Measure) Performance measure use. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... arguments passed precrec::autoplot() type = "roc" "prc". Useful e.g. remove confidence bands show_cb = FALSE.

title: Plots for Benchmark Results — autoplot.BenchmarkResult
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Benchmark Results — autoplot.BenchmarkResult
text: Saito T, Rehmsmeier M (2017). “Precrec: fast accurate precision-recall ROC curve calculations R.” Bioinformatics, 33(1), 145-147. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btw570 .

title: Plots for Benchmark Results — autoplot.BenchmarkResult
code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3viz)    tasks = tsks(c("pima", "sonar"))   learner = lrns(c("classif.featureless", "classif.rpart"),     predict_type = "prob")   resampling = rsmps("cv")   object = benchmark(benchmark_grid(tasks, learner, resampling))    head(fortify(object))   autoplot(object)   autoplot(object$clone(deep = TRUE)$filter(task_ids = "pima"), type = "roc") }

what: Plots for Ensemble Feature Selection Results — autoplot.EnsembleFSResult
title: Plots for Ensemble Feature Selection Results — autoplot.EnsembleFSResult
text: Visualizations EnsembleFSResult. argument type determines type plot generated. available options : "pareto" (default): Scatterplot performance versus number features, possibly including Pareto front, allows users decide much performance willing trade sparse model. "performance": Boxplot performance across different learners used ensemble feature selection process. box represents distribution scores across different resampling iterations particular learner. "n_features: Boxplot number features selected learner different resampling iterations. "stability": Barplot stability score learner used ensemble feature selection. plot shows similar output feature sets learner across different resamplings.

title: Plots for Ensemble Feature Selection Results — autoplot.EnsembleFSResult
code: # S3 method for class 'EnsembleFSResult' autoplot(   object,   type = "pareto",   pareto_front = "stepwise",   stability_measure = "jaccard",   stability_args = NULL,   theme = theme_minimal(),   ... )

title: Plots for Ensemble Feature Selection Results — autoplot.EnsembleFSResult
text: object (mlr3fselect::EnsembleFSResult). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. pareto_front (character(1)) Type pareto front plot. Can "stepwise" (default), "estimated" "none". stability_measure (character(1)) stability measure used case type = "stability". One measures returned stabm::listStabilityMeasures() lower case. Default "jaccard". stability_args (list) Additional arguments passed stability measure function. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Ensemble Feature Selection Results — autoplot.EnsembleFSResult
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Ensemble Feature Selection Results — autoplot.EnsembleFSResult
code: # \donttest{ if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3fselect)    set.seed (42)   efsr = ensemble_fselect(     fselector = fs("random_search"),     task = tsk("sonar"),     learners = lrns(c("classif.rpart", "classif.featureless")),     init_resampling = rsmp("subsampling", repeats = 5),     inner_resampling = rsmp("cv", folds = 3),     measure = msr("classif.ce"),     terminator = trm("evals", n_evals = 5)   )    # Pareto front (default, stepwise)   autoplot(efsr)    # Pareto front (estimated)   autoplot(efsr, pareto_front = "estimated")    # Performance   autoplot(efsr, type = "performance")    # Number of features   autoplot(efsr, type = "n_features")    # stability   autoplot(efsr, type = "stability") }  # }

title: Plots for Filter Scores — autoplot.Filter
text: Visualizations mlr3filters::Filter. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "barplot" (default): Bar plot filter scores.

title: Plots for Filter Scores — autoplot.Filter
code: # S3 method for class 'Filter' autoplot(object, type = "boxplot", n = Inf, theme = theme_minimal(), ...)

title: Plots for Filter Scores — autoplot.Filter
text: object (mlr3filters::Filter). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. n (integer(1)) include first n features highest importance. Defaults features. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Filter Scores — autoplot.Filter
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Filter Scores — autoplot.Filter
code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3viz)   library(mlr3filters)    task = tsk("mtcars")   f = flt("correlation")   f$calculate(task)    head(fortify(f))   autoplot(f, n = 5) }

code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3viz)    # classification   task = tsk("iris")   learner = lrn("classif.rpart", keep_model = TRUE)   learner$train(task)   autoplot(learner, type = "ggparty")    # regression   task = tsk("mtcars")   learner = lrn("regr.rpart", keep_model = TRUE)   learner$train(task)   autoplot(learner, type = "ggparty") }

what: Plots for Hierarchical Clustering Learners — autoplot.LearnerClustHierarchical
title: Plots for Hierarchical Clustering Learners — autoplot.LearnerClustHierarchical
text: Visualizations hierarchical clusters. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "dend" (default): Dendrograms using ggdendro package. "scree": Scree plot shows number possible clusters x-axis height y-axis.

title: Plots for Hierarchical Clustering Learners — autoplot.LearnerClustHierarchical
code: # S3 method for class 'LearnerClustHierarchical' autoplot(   object,   type = "dend",   task = NULL,   theme = theme_minimal(),   theme_dendro = TRUE,   ... )

title: Plots for Hierarchical Clustering Learners — autoplot.LearnerClustHierarchical
text: object (mlr3cluster::LearnerClustAgnes | mlr3cluster::LearnerClustDiana | mlr3cluster::LearnerClustHclust). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. task (mlr3::Task) Optionally, pass task add labels observations hclust dendrogram. Labels set via row names task. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. theme_dendro (logical(1)) TRUE (default), special dendrogram theme ggdendro package used plot "dend". Set FALSE use theme passed theme. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Hierarchical Clustering Learners — autoplot.LearnerClustHierarchical
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Hierarchical Clustering Learners — autoplot.LearnerClustHierarchical
code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3cluster)   library(mlr3viz)    task = tsk("usarrests")    # agnes clustering   learner = lrn("clust.agnes")   learner$train(task)   autoplot(learner)    # diana clustering   learner = lrn("clust.diana")   learner$train(task)   autoplot(learner)    # hclust clustering   learner = lrn("clust.hclust")   learner$train(task)   autoplot(learner, type = "scree") }

title: Plots for Optimization Instances — autoplot.OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit
text: Visualizations bbotk::OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "marginal" (default): Scatter plots x versus y. color points shows batch number. "performance": Scatter plots batch number versus y "parameter": Scatter plots batch number versus input. color points shows y values. "parallel": Parallel coordinates plot. x values rescaled (x - mean(x)) / sd(x). "points": Scatter plot two x dimensions versus. color points shows y values. "surface": Surface plot two x dimensions versus y values. y values interpolated supplied mlr3::Learner. "pairs": Plots x y values . "incumbent": Plots incumbent versus number configurations.

title: Plots for Optimization Instances — autoplot.OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit
code: # S3 method for class 'OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit' autoplot(   object,   type = "marginal",   cols_x = NULL,   trafo = FALSE,   learner = mlr3::lrn("regr.ranger"),   grid_resolution = 100,   batch = NULL,   theme = theme_minimal(),   ... )

title: Plots for Optimization Instances — autoplot.OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit
text: object (bbotk::OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. cols_x (character()) Column names x values. default, untransformed x values search space plotted. Transformed hyperparameters prefixed x_domain_. trafo (logical(1)) FALSE (default), untransformed x values plotted. TRUE, transformed x values plotted. learner (mlr3::Learner) Regression learner used interpolate data surface plot. grid_resolution (numeric()) Resolution surface plot. batch (integer()) batch number(s) limit plot . default batches. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Optimization Instances — autoplot.OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Optimization Instances — autoplot.OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit
code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3") && requireNamespace("bbotk") && requireNamespace("patchwork")) {   library(bbotk)   library(paradox)    fun = function(xs) {     c(y = -(xs[[1]] - 2)^2 - (xs[[2]] + 3)^2 + 10)   }   domain = ps(     x1 = p_dbl(-10, 10),     x2 = p_dbl(-5, 5)   )   codomain = ps(     y = p_dbl(tags = "maximize")   )   obfun = ObjectiveRFun$new(     fun = fun,     domain = domain,     codomain = codomain   )    instance = oi(objective = obfun, terminator = trm("evals", n_evals = 20))    optimizer = opt("random_search", batch_size = 2)   optimizer$optimize(instance)    # plot y versus batch number   print(autoplot(instance, type = "performance"))    # plot x1 values versus performance   print(autoplot(instance, type = "marginal", cols_x = "x1"))    # plot parallel coordinates plot   print(autoplot(instance, type = "parallel"))    # plot pairs   print(autoplot(instance, type = "pairs"))    # plot incumbent   print(autoplot(instance, type = "incumbent")) } #> Loading required namespace: patchwork #> Loading required package: paradox    #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'GGally': #>   method from    #>   +.gg   ggplot2

title: Plots for Classification Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClassif
text: Visualizations mlr3::PredictionClassif. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "stacked" (default): Stacked barplot true estimated class labels. "roc": ROC curve (1 - specificity x, sensitivity y). Requires package precrec. "prc": Precision recall curve. Requires package precrec. "threshold": Systematically varies threshold mlr3::PredictionClassif object plots resulting performance returned measure.

title: Plots for Classification Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClassif
code: # S3 method for class 'PredictionClassif' autoplot(   object,   type = "stacked",   measure = NULL,   theme = theme_minimal(),   ... )

title: Plots for Classification Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClassif
text: object (mlr3::PredictionClassif). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. measure (mlr3::Measure) Performance measure use. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Classification Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClassif
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Classification Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClassif

title: Plots for Classification Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClassif
code: # \donttest{ if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3viz)    task = tsk("spam")   learner = lrn("classif.rpart", predict_type = "prob")   object = learner$train(task)$predict(task)    head(fortify(object))   autoplot(object)   autoplot(object, type = "roc")   autoplot(object, type = "prc") }  # }

title: Plots for Cluster Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClust
text: Visualizations mlr3cluster::PredictionClust. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "scatter" (default): scatterplot correlation values colored cluster assignments. "sil": Silhouette plot mean silhouette value reference line. Requires package ggfortify. "pca": Perform PCA data color code cluster assignments. Inspired uses ggfortify::autoplot.kmeans.

title: Plots for Cluster Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClust
code: # S3 method for class 'PredictionClust' autoplot(   object,   task,   row_ids = NULL,   type = "scatter",   theme = theme_minimal(),   ... )

title: Plots for Cluster Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClust
text: object (mlr3cluster::PredictionClust). task (mlr3cluster::TaskClust). row_ids (integer()) Row ids subset task data ensure data used make predictions shown plots. type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Cluster Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClust
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Cluster Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClust

title: Plots for Cluster Predictions — autoplot.PredictionClust
code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3cluster)   library(mlr3viz)    task = tsk("usarrests")   learner = lrn("clust.kmeans", centers = 3)   object = learner$train(task)$predict(task)    head(fortify(object))   autoplot(object, task) } #> Warning: Factor variables are omitted in plot

title: Plots for Regression Predictions — autoplot.PredictionRegr
text: Visualizations mlr3::PredictionRegr. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "xy" (default): Scatterplot "true" response vs. "predicted" response. default linear model fitted via geom_smooth(method = "lm") visualize trend x y (default colored blue). addition geom_abline() slope = 1 added plot. Note geom_smooth() geom_abline() may overlap, depending given data. "histogram": Histogram residuals: \(r = y - \hat{y}\). "residual": Plot residuals, response \(\hat{y}\) "x" residuals "y" axis. default linear model fitted via geom_smooth(method = "lm") visualize trend x y (default colored blue). "confidence: Scatterplot "true" response vs. "predicted" response confidence intervals. Error bars calculated object$reponse +- quantile * object$se possible predict_type = "se". geom_abline() slope = 1 added plot.

title: Plots for Regression Predictions — autoplot.PredictionRegr
code: # S3 method for class 'PredictionRegr' autoplot(   object,   type = "xy",   binwidth = NULL,   theme = theme_minimal(),   quantile = 1.96,   ... )

title: Plots for Regression Predictions — autoplot.PredictionRegr
text: object (mlr3::PredictionRegr). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. binwidth (integer(1)) Width bins histogram. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. quantile (numeric(1)) Quantile multiplier standard errors type="confidence". Default 1.96. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Regression Predictions — autoplot.PredictionRegr
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Regression Predictions — autoplot.PredictionRegr
code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3viz)    task = tsk("mtcars")   learner = lrn("regr.rpart")   object = learner$train(task)$predict(task)    head(fortify(object))   autoplot(object)   autoplot(object, type = "histogram", binwidth = 1)   autoplot(object, type = "residual")   if (requireNamespace("mlr3learners")) {   library(mlr3learners)   learner = lrn("regr.ranger", predict_type = "se")   object = learner$train(task)$predict(task)   autoplot(object, type = "confidence")  } }

title: Plots for Resample Results — autoplot.ResampleResult
text: Visualizations mlr3::ResampleResult. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "boxplot" (default): Boxplot performance measures. "histogram": Histogram performance measures. "roc": ROC curve (1 - specificity x, sensitivity y). predictions individual mlr3::Resamplings merged prior calculating ROC curve (micro averaged). Requires package precrec. "prc": Precision recall curve. See "roc". "prediction": Plots learner prediction grid points. Needs models stored. Set store_models = TRUE mlr3::resample(). classification, support tasks exactly two features learners predict_type= set "response" "prob". regression, support tasks one two features. tasks one feature can print confidence bounds predict type learner set "se". tasks two features predict type ignored.

title: Plots for Resample Results — autoplot.ResampleResult
code: # S3 method for class 'ResampleResult' autoplot(   object,   type = "boxplot",   measure = NULL,   predict_sets = "test",   binwidth = NULL,   theme = theme_minimal(),   ... )

title: Plots for Resample Results — autoplot.ResampleResult
text: object (mlr3::ResampleResult). type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. measure (mlr3::Measure) Performance measure use. predict_sets (character()) type set "prediction". points shown plot? Can subset ("train", "test") empty. binwidth (integer(1)) Width bins histogram. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... arguments passed precrec::autoplot() type = "roc" "prc". Useful e.g. remove confidence bands show_cb = FALSE.

title: Plots for Resample Results — autoplot.ResampleResult
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Resample Results — autoplot.ResampleResult
text: Saito T, Rehmsmeier M (2017). “Precrec: fast accurate precision-recall ROC curve calculations R.” Bioinformatics, 33(1), 145-147. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btw570 .

title: Plots for Resample Results — autoplot.ResampleResult
code: # \donttest{ if (requireNamespace("mlr3")) {   library(mlr3)   library(mlr3viz)    task = tsk("sonar")   learner = lrn("classif.rpart", predict_type = "prob")   resampling = rsmp("cv", folds = 3)   object = resample(task, learner, resampling)    head(fortify(object))    # Default: boxplot   autoplot(object)    # Histogram   autoplot(object, type = "histogram", bins = 30)    # ROC curve, averaged over resampling folds:   autoplot(object, type = "roc")    # ROC curve of joint prediction object:   autoplot(object$prediction(), type = "roc")    # Precision Recall Curve   autoplot(object, type = "prc")    # Prediction Plot   task = tsk("iris")$select(c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width"))   resampling = rsmp("cv", folds = 3)   object = resample(task, learner, resampling, store_models = TRUE)   autoplot(object, type = "prediction") }  # }

title: Plots for Tuning Instances — autoplot.TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit
text: Visualizations mlr3tuning::TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit. argument type controls kind plot drawn. Possible choices : "marginal" (default): Scatter plots x versus y. color points shows batch number. "performance": Scatter plots batch number versus y "parameter": Scatter plots batch number versus input. color points shows y values. "parallel": Parallel coordinates plot. hyperparameters rescaled (x - mean(x)) / sd(x). "points": Scatter plot two x dimensions versus. color points shows y values. "surface": Surface plot two x dimensions versus y values. y values interpolated supplied mlr3::Learner. "pairs": Plots x y values . "incumbent": Plots incumbent versus number configurations.

title: Plots for Tuning Instances — autoplot.TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit
code: # S3 method for class 'TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit' autoplot(   object,   type = "marginal",   cols_x = NULL,   trafo = FALSE,   learner = mlr3::lrn("regr.ranger"),   grid_resolution = 100,   theme = theme_minimal(),   ... )

title: Plots for Tuning Instances — autoplot.TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit
text: object (mlr3tuning::TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit. type (character(1)): Type plot. See description. cols_x (character()) Column names hyperparameters. default, untransformed hyperparameters plotted. Transformed hyperparameters prefixed x_domain_. trafo (logical(1)) FALSE (default), untransformed hyperparameters plotted. TRUE, transformed hyperparameters plotted. learner (mlr3::Learner) Regression learner used interpolate data surface plot. grid_resolution (numeric()) Resolution surface plot. theme (ggplot2::theme()) ggplot2::theme_minimal() applied default plots. ... (ignored).

title: Plots for Tuning Instances — autoplot.TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Plots for Tuning Instances — autoplot.TuningInstanceBatchSingleCrit
code: if (requireNamespace("mlr3tuning") && requireNamespace("patchwork")) {   library(mlr3tuning)    learner = lrn("classif.rpart")   learner$param_set$values$cp = to_tune(0.001, 0.1)   learner$param_set$values$minsplit = to_tune(1, 10)    instance = ti(     task = tsk("iris"),     learner = learner,     resampling = rsmp("holdout"),     measure = msr("classif.ce"),     terminator = trm("evals", n_evals = 10))    tuner = tnr("random_search")    tuner$optimize(instance)    # plot performance versus batch number   autoplot(instance, type = "performance")    # plot cp values versus performance   autoplot(instance, type = "marginal", cols_x = "cp")    # plot transformed parameter values versus batch number   autoplot(instance, type = "parameter", trafo = TRUE)    # plot parallel coordinates plot   autoplot(instance, type = "parallel")    # plot pairs   autoplot(instance, type = "pairs") } #> Warning: the standard deviation is zero #> Warning: the standard deviation is zero #> Warning: the standard deviation is zero

title: mlr3viz: Visualizations for 'mlr3' — mlr3viz-package
text: Visualization package 'mlr3' ecosystem. features plots mlr3 objects tasks, learners, predictions, benchmark results, tuning instances filters via 'autoplot()' generic 'ggplot2'. package draws plots 'viridis' color palette applies minimal theme. Visualizations include barplots, boxplots, histograms, ROC curves, Precision-Recall curves.

title: mlr3viz: Visualizations for 'mlr3' — mlr3viz-package
text: Maintainer: Marc Becker marcbecker@posteo.de (ORCID) Authors: Michel Lang michellang@gmail.com (ORCID) Patrick Schratz patrick.schratz@gmail.com (ORCID) Raphael Sonabend raphael.sonabend.15@ucl.ac.uk (ORCID) Jakob Richter jakob1richter@gmail.com (ORCID) John Zobolas bblodfon@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: Damir Pulatov dpulatov@uwyo.edu [contributor]

title: Plots for Learner Predictions — plot_learner_prediction
text: Visualizations mlr3::Prediction single mlr3::Learner single mlr3::Task. classification support tasks exactly two features learners predict_type set "response" "prob". regression support tasks one two features. tasks one feature print confidence bounds predict type learner set "se". tasks two features predict type ignored. Note function wrapper around autoplot.ResampleResult() temporary mlr3::ResampleResult using mlr3::mlr_resamplings_holdout ratio 1 (observations training set).

title: Plots for Learner Predictions — plot_learner_prediction
code: plot_learner_prediction(learner, task, grid_points = 100L, expand_range = 0)

title: Plots for Learner Predictions — plot_learner_prediction
text: learner (mlr3::Learner). task (mlr3::Task). grid_points (integer(1)) Resolution grid. factors, ordered logicals value ignored. expand_range (numeric(1)) Expand prediction range numerical features.

title: Plots for Learner Predictions — plot_learner_prediction
text: ggplot2::ggplot().

text: Allow passing parameters precrec::autoplot() (eg show_cb) plotting BenchmarkResult ResampleResult objects, using type = roc prc. Refactor: wrong type autoplots now gives hints ones use.

title: mlr3viz 0.6.2
text: CRAN release: 2023-11-23 Fix snapshots bbotk 0.7.3. Add "incumbent" plot OptimInstanceSingleCrit.

title: mlr3viz 0.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-01-23 Add binwidth argument histogram plots. "performance" plot always connected maximum performance values. Now minimum values connected measure minimized.

title: mlr3viz 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-01-12 Add theme option autoplot() functions supply ggplot2::theme(). default ggplot2::theme_minimal(). Remove theme_mlr3(). Unify plot layouts. Remove support passing extra arguments geom_ functions via .... behavior consistent across autoplot() functions.

title: mlr3viz 0.5.1

title: mlr3viz 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-11-02 New autoplot PredictionSurv. New autoplots learners package glmnet via ggfortify. Fixed ROC PRC plots resampling "holdout" (#54). possible, now show confidence bounds ROC PRC plots (#55). Fixed bug autoplot function TaskDens (#57).

title: mlr3viz 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-05 autoplot.*() functions now also generic S3 plot() sibling (#51). New plots cluster tasks, learners predictions mlr3cluster. Fixed wrong labels boxplots BenchmarkResult.

title: mlr3viz 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-25 Compatibility mlr3 >= 0.6.0.

title: mlr3viz 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-07 Added plots TaskDens TaskSurv package mlr3proba. Update documentation PredictionRegr (#23) autoplot.BenchmarkResult(): Support learners identical IDs (#19) Fixed bug plot_learner_prediction() (#47)

title: mlr3viz 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-19 New plot: learner prediction objects class ResampleResult. Additionally, helper function plot_learner_prediction() first performs resample() plots result. New plot: residual plot objects class PredictionRegr.

title: mlr3viz 0.1.0
